Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Stericycle agreed to pay $320,000 in settlement of allegations the company used its market power to exclude competitors from the medical waste transportation market.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20030304034948/http://www.attorney_general.state.az.us/press_releases/aug/081402b.html
https://www.nj.gov/oag/newsreleases19/pr20190426a.html

Description: Stericycle agreed to pay $26.75 million to a group of states and the federal government to settle allegations of overcharging public entities in its medical waste disposal contracts.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20170706210020/http://www.illinoisattorneygeneral.gov/pressroom/2015_10/20151030b.html

Description: Stericycle agreed to sell some operations and to pay $25,000 each to Connecticut and Massachusetts to resolve a lawsuit brought by the two states over the anti-competitive impact of the company's plan to purchase Scherer Healthcare and Bridgeview Inc.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20030508230758/http://www.ago.state.ma.us/press_rel/stericycle.asp

Description: The New York Attorney General announced a $2.4 million settlement with medical waste disposal company Stericycle, Inc. concerning allegations that it improperly overcharged nearly 1,000 New York government entities, including police and fire departments, rescue squads, schools, jails, and hospitals.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20171125131848/https://ag.ny.gov/press-release/ag-schneiderman-announces-24-million-settlement-stericycle-overcharging-ny-state-and
https://web.archive.org/web/20120416180312/http://attorneygeneral.utah.gov/620.html
